channel.title: Raising Your StreetIQ
channel.description: Stephen Malaster is an amalgam of several industries, positions, and life experiences. A true jack of many trades, Stephen has knowledge in Semiconductor, Finance, Retail, and a number of other sectors. "My goal is to give listeners both insightful and entertaining content." The key focus of Raising Your StreetIQ are companies, people, products and services that touch our daily lives. Stephen lives in San Mateo, California with his wife Mercedes and a French bulldog pup named Boris.

Stephen lives in San Mateo, California with his wife Mercedes and a French bulldog pup named Boris.

item.title: MAGIC - The Business of Fashion
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Christopher McCabe, VP and General Manager of MAGIC provides a brief description of this renowned event where the industry conducts a significant portion of their annual business.
item.itunes:subtitle: Christopher McCabe, VP and General Manager of MAGIC provides a brief description of this renowned event where the industry conducts a significant portion of their annual business.

item.title: Swimming into Vegas the Speedo Way
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Hear how the largest swimwear company in the world Speedo is still leading the competition. Big news awaits for the swimmers at the Beijing Olympiad (WRNC)

item.title: Russell Athletic, Fashions Value Play
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Listen to Stephen Malaster's interview of Alex Hodges, VP Marketing at Russell Athletic Group. Gain insights into the many brands under Russell and learn about some of their latest technology. (BRKa)

item.title: Interview With Earth Tones Trading Co.
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Andre Aggasi once said image is everything. What he left out was the need for a great license partner like Earth Tones. Learn why White Castle, Nathan's Famous, and John Deere come to Larry Levine, President and CEO of Earth Tones to get their brands to the masses. (DE) (NATH)

item.title: The Business of Brands and Licensing
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Stephen Malaster speaks with Jesse Will about Trinity Products history and their exclusive licensing of name brands like WWE and Corona. Learn just how big and how important this side of the apparel business is for the brands they represent. (WWE)

item.title: Alibaba - Changing Global Sourcing
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: MAGIC brings over 3000 exhibitors to Las Vegas and Alibaba brings tens of thousands more to your PC. Learn about the future of sourcing from Brian Wong, Sr. Director International Marketing at Alibaba.

item.title: The Uniform Makes the Kid at MAGIC
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Cherokee Group Inc. (CHKE) sold off the uniform division back in 1995. Today that division is thriving as a private company called Strategic Partners. Get the scoop from Bill Bosch, VP Sales & Marketing on where they have taken the business.

item.title: Inside Perry Ellis International
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: If diversification is the key to steady growth, then Perry Ellis has the formula down pat. From Munsingwear to Redsand, to Original Penguin, Perry Ellis covers all demographics. StreetIQ gets the details from Keva Silversmith, Dir. Corporate Communications. (PERY)

item.title: Exploring the Science of Fashion with Columbia
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description:
Some apparel companies are about style and some are about function. Columbia has fused both and profited. Learn how and why this company is a mainstay from Public Relations Manager John Fread.(COLM)

SPECIAL: Show How Extreme You Are.
Enter The Titanium Challenge:

item.title: Keeping in Time with Fossil's Growth
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Few companies in the watch segment can boast such rapid brand domination and continuous growth. Hear how Fossil is now expanding into new lines. StreetIQ talks with Tim Burkhart, Sr. Director Independent Specialty Sales. (FOSL)

item.title: XOXO Staying True to Demographics
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Christina Cassar, Dir. Marketing explains how keeping true to a core product, XOXO has maintained growth. XOXO has selected super model Alessandra to define this year's line. (KWD)

item.title: Pop Quiz - Who Buys Playboy?
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Well, if you are talking about the apparel business, it is overwhelmingly women. Hear from Playboy's Aaron Duncan, SVP Creative Director and Adrianna Chinnici, Director of Licensing on their strong apparel business and trends for the future. (PLA)

item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)

item.title: Street Ball Phenomenon AND1 Keeps Growing
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Get the story on AND1 from apparel to video games, a passion becomes an industry. David Williams, General Manager takes a moment with Stephen Malaster to explain the history and future. SPECIAL: Following the interview comments from Air Up There, the first human to complete a 720* dunk and The Professor, one of basketball's most creative ball handlers.

item.title: What is Hustler Inc?
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Like a definition out of Webster's dictionary, Eric Gullet, Hustler VP says, "We're Hustler, it's self explanatory". Hear more details about Hustler and their impact on the industry of fashion and image.

item.title: Lowrider Takes Its Brand to the Street
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Interview with Julie Smartz, Dir. Retail Development for Primedia. Primedia knows the US culture like few others. With brands like Lowrider being picked up in the street wear movement, growth is sure to follow. Hear how the apparel segment has done over the past three years. (PRM)

item.title: K-Swiss True Performance... and More
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Barry Sherbal, VP Sales for K-Swiss talks about remaining true to their technology heritage and building the best performance tennis sneaker in the biz. Kids are now asking, can he/she play, or are they just stylin'? (KSWS)

item.title: CES 2006 - Netgear
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Interview with Vivek Pathela, Senior Director, Product, Management & Marketing After becoming one of the dominant players in the switching, wireless, and network security businesses, Netgear(NTGR) broadens its consumer product lines embracing VOIP.

item.title: CES 2006 - Vonage
item.author: noemail@noemail.org (streetiq)
item.description: Interview with Mitchell Slepian, Media Relations Manager Using an existing high-speed Internet connection, Vonage technology enables anyone to make and receive phone calls - worldwide - with a touch-tone telephone. Check out Vonage's new portable WiFi handset developed by partner UTStarcom.
